newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai mutual fund firms seek higher stock limit.
newsitem.headline: Thai mutual fund firms seek higher stock limit.

text.p: Thailand's Association of Investment Management Companies will propose to the finance ministry that the limit on stock investment by pension funds be raised to 20 percent of a fund's value from five percent.

The move would increase the amount of long-term funds in the stock market which has fallen sharply over the past few weeks, the president of the association, Teera Phutrakul, told a seminar on Wednesday.
"(Finance) authorities should find new money to support the market. Funds should be long term and from domestic sources to avoid swift movements and volatility," he said.
Under existing law, pension funds are required to invest 60 percent of their funds in bank deposits while only five percent is allowed to be invested in common shares, he said.
He said the recent establishment of a market support fund was a short-term solution and would not directly tackle the Thai market's fundamental problems.
